question.title: Will Iran carry out a deadly attack within Israel before May 1, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves **Yes** if, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Iran and occurring within Israel's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Iran will execute a lethal assault inside Israel prior to May 1, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if, after the date this question is published and before May 1, 2024, trustworthy reports suggest that an assault linked to Iran and taking place within the territory of Israel has resulted in the fatalities of at least five people.

question.title: Is it expected that Iran will execute a lethal assault inside Israel by May 1, 2024?
question.body: This question will be answered with a **Yes** if, after the publication date of this question and before May 1, 2024, there are credible reports of an attack linked to Iran that takes place within Israel's borders and results in the death of at least five people.

para_P.title: Is there an anticipation of Iran launching a deadly attack within Israel by May 1, 2024?
para_P.body: This question will receive a **Yes** response if, following the date this question is published and prior to May 1, 2024, there are reliable accounts of an assault associated with Iran occurring within the territory of Israel that leads to the fatalities of no fewer than five individuals.

question.title: Will OpenAI publish a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, OpenAI publishes a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

para_P.title: Is it expected that OpenAI will release a report detailing the findings from an external assessment of their models regarding safety before June 30, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be resolved as **YES** if OpenAI makes available a *public* report by June 30, 2024, which includes the results from an *external* evaluation of the safety of one of their AI models.

question.title: Is OpenAI going to release a report detailing the outcomes of an external safety red-teaming of their models by June 30, 2024?
question.body: This question will be answered with a **YES** if OpenAI makes a *public* report available by June 30, 2024, which contains the findings from an *external* entity conducting a safety red-teaming of one of their AI models.

para_P.title: Will OpenAI publish a report summarizing the results of an outside safety red-teaming assessment of their models by June 30, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will receive a **YES** response if OpenAI releases a *public* report by June 30, 2024, that includes the results from an *external* organization performing a safety red-teaming evaluation of one of their AI models.

question.title: Will Croatia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Croatia participates in a Semi-final and is then officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Otherwise, it will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Does Croatia have a chance to reach the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Croatia competes in a Semi-final and is subsequently confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024. If not, it will conclude with a **No**.

question.title: Will Croatia advance to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final?
question.body: This question will be answered with a **Yes** if Croatia competes in a Semi-final and is subsequently declared by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) to have advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If not, it will be answered with a **No**.

para_P.title: Is Croatia going to make it to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: A response of **Yes** will be given if Croatia participates in a Semi-final and is later announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having progressed to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024. Otherwise, the answer will be **No**.

question.title: At the Paris Summer Olympics in 2024, will the men's 100m dash winning time break the Olympic record of 9.63s?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if any athlete runs the Men's 100M race at the 2024 Paris Summer Olympics in less than 9.63s, according to results posted by the [International Olympic Committee](https://olympics.com/en/olympic-games/olympic-results) or credible sources. If this does not happen, this question resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: Will the winning time for the men's 100m sprint at the 2024 Paris Summer Olympics surpass the Olympic record of 9.63 seconds?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if any competitor completes the Men's 100M event at the 2024 Paris Summer Olympics in a time shorter than 9.63 seconds, as per the results provided by the [International Olympic Committee](https://olympics.com/en/olympic-games/olympic-results) or other reliable sources. Conversely, if this does not occur, the resolution will be **No**.

question.title: Will the Olympic record of 9.63 seconds be surpassed in the men's 100m sprint at the 2024 Paris Summer Olympics?
question.body: The answer to this question will be **Yes** if any competitor completes the Men's 100M event in under 9.63 seconds at the 2024 Paris Summer Olympics, based on the results reported by the [International Olympic Committee](https://olympics.com/en/olympic-games/olympic-results) or other reliable sources. If no athlete achieves this, the answer will be **No**.

para_P.title: Will the men's 100m sprint record of 9.63 seconds be broken at the 2024 Summer Olympics in Paris?
para_P.body: This question will be answered with **Yes** if any athlete finishes the Men's 100M race in less than 9.63 seconds during the 2024 Summer Olympics in Paris, according to results published by the [International Olympic Committee](https://olympics.com/en/olympic-games/olympic-results) or other credible sources. If no competitor achieves this time, the answer will be **No**.

question.title: Will USA top the Olympic Medal Table at Paris 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve positively if the United States Olympic Team are the (unique) highest ranked team at the 2024 Paris Olympics. It will resolve ambiguously if the Paris Olympics do not take place before 2027. It will resolve negatively if any team achieves a higher or equal ranking to the US team.

The medal table is calculated by taking all the medals won by each participating country and ordering by:

1. Number of Gold Medals
2. (Where 1 is tied) Number of Silver Medals
3. (Where 2 is tied) Number of Bronze Medals

para_P.title: Will the United States lead the Olympic Medal Count at the 2024 Paris Games?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered affirmative if the U.S. Olympic Team is the sole highest-ranked team at the Paris 2024 Olympics. It will be deemed uncertain if the Paris Olympics do not occur prior to 2027. It will be regarded as negative if any other team matches or surpasses the ranking of the U.S. team.

The medal standings are determined by tallying the total medals earned by each participating nation and ranking them based on:

1. Total Gold Medals
2. (In case of a tie in Golds) Total Silver Medals
3. (In case of a tie in Silvers) Total Bronze Medals.

question.title: Will the United States lead the medal count at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body:
This inquiry will be affirmed if the United States Olympic Team secures the top position as the sole leader in the rankings at the 2024 Paris Olympics. It will be deemed indeterminate if the Paris Olympics do not occur by 2027. It will be negated if any other team surpasses or matches the ranking of the US team.

The medal standings are determined by tallying all the medals each country wins and ranking them based on:

1. Total Gold Medals
2. (If 1 is tied) Total Silver Medals
3. (If 2 is tied) Total Bronze Medals

para_P.title: Will the United States top the medal standings at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
para_P.body:
This question will be confirmed if the United States Olympic Team achieves the highest rank as the exclusive leader in the standings at the 2024 Paris Olympics. It will be considered uncertain if the Paris Olympics do not take place by 2027. It will be denied if any other team exceeds or equals the ranking of the US team.

The medal standings are established by counting all the medals won by each nation and ranking them according to:

1. Total Gold Medals
2. (If 1 is tied) Total Silver Medals
3. (If 2 is tied) Total Bronze Medals

question.title: Will Doug Burgum be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Doug Burgum is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is Doug Burgum going to be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if Doug Burgum is chosen as the candidate by the Republican National Convention for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will be answered with **No**. This question is not limited to the candidates currently mentioned; additional options may be introduced later.

For the purpose of this question, it does not matter who is nominated by the Republicans on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely based on who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Is Doug Burgum going to be chosen as the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

This inquiry will be answered with a **Yes** if Doug Burgum is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other individual selected will result in a **No**. The question is open to candidates not currently listed, as additional names may be introduced later.

The focus of this question is not on who is the Republican candidate on the day of the 2024 US election; it is exclusively about who the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention) select as their nominee.

para_P.title: Will Doug Burgum be selected as the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This question will receive a **Yes** if Doug Burgum is nominated by the Republican National Convention for the 2024 US Presidential Election. A **No** will be the answer if any other person is chosen. The question remains open to candidates not currently recognized, as new names may emerge later.

This inquiry does not concern who the Republican candidate will be on the date of the 2024 US election; it strictly pertains to who the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention) decide to nominate.

question.title: Will OpenAI's ChatGPT be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024?
question.body:
The question resolves as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise.

"Generally available" here means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If unavailable in certain EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or unavailable to (for example) minors, this will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population can use it.

"ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

para_P.title: Will ChatGPT from OpenAI be accessible to users in the European Union by June 30, 2024?
para_P.body:
This question will be answered with **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is accessible to users in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** if it is not.

Here, "accessible" means that the standard situation for individuals in the EU is that they can reach it without needing a VPN (though they might have to pay for it). If it is not available in some EU countries (as occurred in Italy in early 2023), or if it is not available to certain groups (like minors), it will still be considered a positive outcome if over 50% of the population can access it.

"ChatGPT" refers specifically to the web interface (not the API) used for engaging with GPT models. It will still be considered a positive resolution if the name or site changes, provided that OpenAI's service remains fundamentally the same (allowing users to input queries into systems based on Large Language Models).

question.title: Will OpenAI's ChatGPT be accessible to the general public in the EU on June 30, 2024?
question.body:
This question will be answered with a **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is accessible to the general public in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** if it is not.

"Accessible to the general public" means that the default situation for individuals in the EU is that they can reach it without the need for a VPN (although they might need to pay for access). If it is not accessible in some EU countries (as happened in Italy in early 2023), or not accessible to certain groups (such as minors), it will still be considered accessible as long as more than 50% of the population can use it.

"ChatGPT" refers to the main web platform (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. The question will still resolve positively if the name or site has changed, provided OpenAI's service essentially remains the same (allowing users to input queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

para_P.title: Will OpenAI's ChatGPT be available to the public in the EU on June 30, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will receive a **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is available to the public in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** if it is not.

"Available to the public" indicates that the standard situation for individuals in the EU is that they can access it without requiring a VPN (though they may need to pay for access). If it is inaccessible in some EU nations (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or not available to specific groups (like minors), it will still be deemed available as long as over 50% of the population can utilize it.

"ChatGPT" refers to the primary web platform (not the API) for engaging with GPT models. The question will still yield a positive resolution if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service fundamentally remains the same (enabling users to submit queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

question.title: Between July 17 and July 28, 2024, will the strongest geomagnetic storm have a K-index ("Kp") greater than 4 and less than or equal to 6?
question.body: This question resolves Yes if the highest Planetary K-index ("Kp") between July 17 and July 28, 2024 (inclusive) is greater than 4 and less than or equal to 6, according to the German Research Center for Geosciences in their running 30-day history data product.

para_P.title: During the period from July 17 to July 28, 2024, will there be a geomagnetic storm with a K-index ("Kp") exceeding 4 but not surpassing 6?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a Yes if the maximum Planetary K-index ("Kp") recorded between July 17 and July 28, 2024 (inclusive) is more than 4 and at most 6, based on the data from the German Research Center for Geosciences in their ongoing 30-day historical data product.

question.title: Will the peak geomagnetic storm from July 17 to July 28, 2024, have a K-index ("Kp") exceeding 4 but not surpassing 6?
question.body: This question will be answered with Yes if the maximum Planetary K-index ("Kp") recorded from July 17 to July 28, 2024 (inclusive) is above 4 and does not exceed 6, based on the 30-day historical data provided by the German Research Center for Geosciences.

para_P.title: During the period from July 17 to July 28, 2024, will the highest recorded geomagnetic storm K-index ("Kp") be greater than 4 but less than or equal to 6?
para_P.body: A Yes response will be given if the highest Planetary K-index ("Kp") observed from July 17 to July 28, 2024 (inclusive) is greater than 4 and does not exceed 6, according to the 30-day historical data from the German Research Center for Geosciences.

question.title: Will the maximum weekly rate of hospitalizations per 100,000 in the US occur within four weeks of the combined peak for each of COVID, influenza, and RSV in the 2023-24 season?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if the maximum weekly rate of hospitalizations per 100,000 for each of COVID, influenza, and RSV that occurs in the 2023-24 season is less than or equal to four weeks (28 days) from the date of the maximum rate for all three combined, according to the CDC's [RESP-NET](https://www.cdc.gov/surveillance/resp-net/dashboard.html). The four weeks will be based on the week end dates. The CDC uses "epidemiological weeks" which begin on Sunday and end on Saturday. The rate used will be that for all ages, races, and sexes. See the fine print for the correct filters. For the purposes of this question, the 2023-2024 season will be considered to begin with the week ending on October 7, 2023, and end on the week ending June 1, 2024.

To allow for data revisions and reporting delays the question will resolve according to data shown after the reporting delay period, when the relevant figures for the current season is not shown as a dashed line, typically 4 weeks after the week end date.

para_P.title: Will the peak weekly hospitalization rate per 100,000 individuals in the US happen within four weeks following the joint peak of COVID, influenza, and RSV during the 2023-24 season?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if the highest weekly hospitalization rate per 100,000 for COVID, influenza, and RSV during the 2023-24 season occurs within four weeks (28 days) from the date when the peak rate for all three viruses is recorded, as per the CDC's [RESP-NET](https://www.cdc.gov/surveillance/resp-net/dashboard.html). The four-week period will be calculated based on the end dates of the weeks. The CDC defines "epidemiological weeks" starting on Sunday and concluding on Saturday. The rate considered will encompass all ages, races, and genders. Refer to the fine print for the appropriate filters. For the sake of this question, the 2023-2024 season is defined to start with the week ending on October 7, 2023, and to finish with the week ending on June 1, 2024.

To accommodate for data adjustments and delays in reporting, the question will resolve based on data available after the reporting lag period, when the relevant statistics for the current season are not represented as a dashed line, which is typically four weeks after the week's end date.

question.title: Will the peak weekly hospitalization rate per 100,000 in the US occur within a month of the combined peak for COVID, influenza, and RSV during the 2023-24 season?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if the highest weekly rate of hospitalizations per 100,000 for COVID, influenza, and RSV in the 2023-24 season falls within a month (28 days) of the date when the combined peak rate for all three is reached, based on CDC's [RESP-NET](https://www.cdc.gov/surveillance/resp-net/dashboard.html). The four-week period will be determined using the week end dates. The CDC defines "epidemiological weeks" as starting on Sunday and ending on Saturday. The rate considered will encompass all ages, races, and sexes. Refer to the fine print for the appropriate filters. For this question, the 2023-2024 season is defined as starting with the week ending October 7, 2023, and concluding with the week ending June 1, 2024.

To account for data revisions and reporting lags, the question will be resolved based on data available after the reporting lag period, when the relevant figures for the current season are no longer displayed as a dashed line, typically 4 weeks after the week end date.

para_P.title: Will the highest weekly hospitalization rate per 100,000 in the US happen within a month of the collective peak for COVID, influenza, and RSV during the 2023-24 season?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if the peak weekly hospitalization rate per 100,000 for COVID, influenza, and RSV during the 2023-24 season occurs within a month (28 days) of the date on which the combined peak rate for all three diseases is achieved, according to CDC's [RESP-NET](https://www.cdc.gov/surveillance/resp-net/dashboard.html). The four-week timeframe will be established using the end dates of the weeks. The CDC defines "epidemiological weeks" as commencing on Sunday and concluding on Saturday. The rate assessed will include individuals of all ages, genders, and ethnicities. Please refer to the fine print for the relevant filters. In this context, the 2023-2024 season is defined as beginning with the week ending October 7, 2023, and concluding with the week ending June 1, 2024.

To accommodate data adjustments and reporting delays, the resolution of this question will rely on data accessible after the reporting delay period, at which point the relevant figures for the current season will no longer be represented as a dashed line, generally four weeks following the week ending date.

question.title: Will ECR hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:

This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

para_P.title: Will the ECR secure the highest number of seats following the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?

question.title: Stranded astronauts depart on Boeing Starliner by July 21?
question.body:
Clone of (and resolves identically to) https://polymarket.com/event/stranded-astronauts-depart-on-boeing-starliner-by-july-21?tid=1719805056151

The Boeing Starliner spacecraft, which arrived at the ISS on June 6, 2024, with NASA astronauts Suni Williams and Butch Wilmore, must depart within 45 days due to the Harmony module's limited fuel.

This market will resolve to "Yes" if the Boeing Starliner spacecraft departs the International Space Station (ISS) with NASA astronauts Suni Williams and Butch Wilmore by 11:59 PM ET on July 21, 2024. 

The Starliner will be considered to have departed if it has undocked from the ISS and begun its return journey to Earth.

The resolution source will be official announcements from NASA and/or Boeing, however a consensus of credible reporting may also be used.

para_P.title: Will the astronauts stranded in space leave on the Boeing Starliner before July 21?
para_P.body:
This is a duplicate of (and resolves the same as) https://polymarket.com/event/stranded-astronauts-depart-on-boeing-starliner-by-july-21?tid=1719805056151

The Boeing Starliner spacecraft, which arrived at the ISS on June 6, 2024, carrying NASA astronauts Suni Williams and Butch Wilmore, is required to leave within 45 days due to the limited fuel of the Harmony module.

This market will conclude with a "Yes" if the Boeing Starliner spacecraft departs from the International Space Station (ISS) with NASA astronauts Suni Williams and Butch Wilmore by 11:59 PM ET on July 21, 2024.

The Starliner will be regarded as having left if it undocks from the ISS and initiates its journey back to Earth.

The source for resolution will be official statements from NASA and/or Boeing, although a consensus of reliable reporting may also be considered.

The Boeing Starliner, which reached the International Space Station (ISS) on June 6, 2024, carrying NASA astronauts Suni Williams and Butch Wilmore, must leave within 45 days due to fuel constraints of the Harmony module.

The market will conclude with a "Yes" if the Boeing Starliner spacecraft leaves the ISS with NASA astronauts Suni Williams and Butch Wilmore by 11:59 PM ET on July 21, 2024.

Departure is defined as the Starliner having disconnected from the ISS and starting its journey back to Earth.

Official announcements from NASA and/or Boeing will serve as the resolution source, though a consensus of credible reports may also be considered.

question.title: Will France place in the Top 5 at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body:
This question will resolve positively if France place in the top 5 (ties resolve positively) at the Olympics being held in 2024. It will resolve ambiguously if the Olympics do not take place in 2024.

The medal table is calculated by taking the total number of medals won by each participating country and ordering by:

1. Number of Gold Medals
2. (Where 1 is tied) Number of Silver Medals
3. (Where 2 is tied) Number of Bronze Medal

para_P.title: Will France secure a spot in the Top 5 during the 2024 Paris Olympics?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered affirmative if France secures a position in the top 5 (ties are counted as affirmative) at the Olympics scheduled for 2024. It will be deemed uncertain if the Olympics do not occur in 2024.

The medal standings are determined by summing the total medals earned by each competing nation and ranking them based on:

1. Total Gold Medals
2. (In case of ties for 1st) Total Silver Medals
3. (In case of ties for 2nd) Total Bronze Medals

question.title: Is France going to rank among the top 5 in the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body:
This inquiry will be affirmed if France ranks among the top 5 (ties are considered affirmative) in the Olympics scheduled for 2024. It will be considered ambiguous if the Olympics are not held in 2024.

The ranking of the medal table is determined by counting the total medals each country wins and ordering them by:

1. Number of Gold Medals
2. (In case of a tie in 1) Number of Silver Medals
3. (In case of a tie in 2) Number of Bronze Medals

para_P.title: Will France achieve a position within the top 5 at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
para_P.body:
This question will be confirmed if France secures a spot within the top 5 (ties are considered confirmation) during the Olympics set for 2024. It will be deemed uncertain if the Olympics do not take place in 2024.

The medal table ranking is established by tallying the total medals each nation earns and arranging them based on:

1. Total Gold Medals
2. (If there is a tie in 1) Total Silver Medals
3. (If there is a tie in 2) Total Bronze Medals

question.title: Will Deadpool & Wolverine have biggest opening weekend ever for R-rated movie? [ahead of Deadpool I & II, It, Joker]
question.body:
Analysts are projecting a huge opening weekend for "Deadpool x Wolverine" crossover movie.
https://deepnewz.com/movies/deadpool-wolverine-set-record-360m-global-opening-weekend-biggest-r-rated-debut

"""

The film, directed by Shawn Levy and starring Ryan Reynolds, is projected to earn between $340 million and $360 million globally in its opening weekend. This would mark the biggest opening weekend ever for an R-rated movie. Domestically, the film is expected to debut with $160 million to $170 million, making it the biggest R-rated opening of all-time.

"""

[image]The record for biggest opening weekend for an R-rated movie is the original Deadpool at $284.5M ($152.2M domestic).

https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/movies/movie-news/box-office-deadpool-makes-history-865143/

[image]
Will the new movie top these marks? It will probably be close...

It will certainly play at more theaters... Deadpool was a smash hit at the time, and a bit surprising.

Since BoxOfficeMojo is a bit weird on reporting international opening weekends -- it provides the raw numbers but aggregates them weirdly -- we will wait for Hollywood Reporter to let us know what the weekend opening was.

To clarify on resolution...
-> this market will resolve YES if Deadpool x Wolverine grosses more than $284.5M globally this opening weekend according to reports
-> AND the Hollywood Reporter (or equivalent publication) reports it as the record for an R-rated movie release

In other words the BoxOfficeMojo numbers should be seen as unofficial until there's confirmation in the Hollywood press. And the number we shoot for is >$284.5M internationally... this weekend

question.title: Will diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if before August 1, 2024, one of these four events happens, according to official statements or [credible reports](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions): 

- The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC). 

- The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.

- The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.

- The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines. 

If there are no such reports before that date, then this resolves as **No**.

- The Philippines dismisses at least one diplomat from the People's Republic of China (PRC). 

- The Philippines withdraws at least one of its diplomats from the PRC.

- The PRC dismisses at least one diplomat from the Philippines.

- The PRC withdraws at least one of its diplomats from the Philippines. 

If no such reports arise before that date, then this will be resolved as **No**.

question.title: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents?
question.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6.  One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error.  Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).  The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03.  Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

para_P.title: If Trump competes against Joe Biden rather than a standard Democrat, will he secure at least a 3% increase among Manifold participants?
para_P.body:
Two polls from Manifold are available, both concluding on July 6. One poll prompts Manifold participants to cast their votes alongside Joe Biden on a theoretical ballot, while another invites them to vote with a standard Democrat on the same theoretical ballot.

Public sentiment surveys consistently indicate Joe Biden trailing Donald Trump beyond the margin of error, whereas every other Democrat surveyed hypothetically either leads or remains within the margin of error. Do the Manifold participants reflect the broader population?

This market will be resolved with a YES if Donald Trump's vote percentage in the first poll surpasses that in the second poll by 3% or more when both polls conclude.

To calculate Trump's voting percentage, the formula used is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in question) + Someone else)). The outcome is YES if the difference between the formula for poll 1 and the formula for poll 2 is at least 0.03. If not, the outcome is NO.

These polls and this inquiry will never conclude as N/A and will remain open until the designated closing time regardless of circumstances.

question.title: [Metaculus] Will the domestic box office opening of "Deadpool & Wolverine" be higher than th..."The Wolverine" combined?
question.body:
Will the domestic box office opening of "Deadpool & Wolverine" be higher than that of "Deadpool" and "The Wolverine" combined?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25850/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question resolves as Yes if the domestic box office opening for the Deadpool & Wolverine reported by Boxofficemojo on the movie's page is higher than $185,548,391 which is the sum of the box openings for Deadpool (2016) and The Wolverine (2013): $132,434,639 + $53,113,752.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

question.title: Will a group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
question.body:
Politico reports:

Two safe-seat members have already publicly urged Biden out. Two of the most endangered Democrats told local news outlets they’ve already written off Biden’s chances to win in November.

Behind the scenes, things are even more frenzied. There are multiple drafts of letters circulating among House Democrats and at least one would call on Biden to end his campaign, according to five people familiar with the efforts.

This market resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could be by signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out.

This market requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving NO. 

If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

para_P.title: Will at least five identified Democratic House Members or Senators compel Biden to withdraw before July 20th?
para_P.body:
According to Politico:

Two members from secure districts have already publicly called for Biden to step aside. Additionally, two of the most vulnerable Democrats have expressed to local media that they believe Biden's chances for victory in November are slim.

Behind the scenes, the situation is even more chaotic. There are several versions of letters being circulated among House Democrats, and at least one draft would request Biden to conclude his campaign, as per five individuals familiar with the discussions.

This market will resolve to YES if a coalition of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members or Senators collaborates to ask Joe Biden to contemplate ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to strongly encourage him to do so, prior to Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could occur through signing a letter similar to the one mentioned above, or through other means such as a group meeting with Biden in person to collectively request that he withdraw.

This market stipulates that all five individuals must be part of the same collective communication. If five individuals independently express to reporters their belief that Biden should step down, it will not count as a YES.

Reports of any number of unnamed Democrats reaching out to Biden to request he step aside will not meet the criteria for this market unless at least five qualifying names are disclosed publicly before the market closes. In cases where such names are reported but not confirmed with high certainty, the market will lean towards a NO resolution.

If these conditions are not fulfilled by July 20th, the market will resolve to NO.

question.title: Will at least five specific Democratic House Members or US Senators collectively push for Biden to withdraw before July 20th?
question.body:
According to Politico:

Two members from secure districts have already openly called for Biden to step down. Additionally, two highly vulnerable Democrats have told local media that they no longer believe Biden can win in November.

The situation is even more intense behind the scenes. Several versions of letters are being circulated among House Democrats, and at least one of these letters urges Biden to cease his campaign, as per five individuals familiar with these activities.

This question will resolve as YES if a group of at least five specific Democratic US House Members or Senators jointly request Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election bid, or urge him to do so, before Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could be through signing a letter similar to what is described above, but it could also be in another form, such as a group meeting with Biden in person and collectively asking him to withdraw.

For a YES resolution, all five individuals must be part of the same collective action. Five individuals separately telling the media that they believe Biden should step down is insufficient.

Reports of any number of unnamed Democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step down will not meet the criteria unless at least five qualifying names are publicly disclosed before the market's end date. In any unclear situations where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, the market will lean towards resolving NO.

If these conditions are not fulfilled by July 20th, the market resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will a group of at least five specific Democratic House Members or US Senators collectively advocate for Biden's withdrawal prior to July 20th?
para_P.body:
According to Politico:

Two representatives from secure districts have already publicly urged Biden to resign. Furthermore, two highly at-risk Democrats have communicated to local media that they no longer believe Biden can secure victory in November.

The situation is even more pressing behind closed doors. Various drafts of letters are being circulated among House Democrats, and at least one of these letters calls for Biden to halt his campaign, according to five individuals familiar with these discussions.

This question will be answered with YES if a coalition of at least five specific Democratic US House Members or Senators jointly implore Joe Biden to contemplate withdrawing from his 2024 re-election campaign, or encourage him to do so, before Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could be through signing a letter akin to what has been mentioned above, but it could also take another form, such as a group meeting with Biden in person and collectively requesting him to step down.

For a YES resolution, all five individuals must be part of the same collective action. Five individuals independently stating to the media that they believe Biden should resign is not adequate.

Reports of any number of unnamed Democrats contacting Biden and asking him to resign will not satisfy the criteria unless at least five qualifying names are publicly disclosed before the market's closing date. In any ambiguous situations where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, the market will tend towards resolving NO.

If these conditions are not met by July 20th, the market will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will Donald Trump Jr. be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump Jr. is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently mentioned; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

Any other candidates will result in a **No**. This question is not limited to the candidates currently mentioned; additional options may emerge later.

question.title: Will Donald Trump Jr. secure the Republican nomination for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

Any other candidate being selected will result in a **No** resolution. The question is open to candidates not currently mentioned; new candidates may emerge later.

The resolution of this question is based solely on the individual chosen by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention), irrespective of who is nominated on the day of the 2024 US election.

para_P.title: Is Donald Trump Jr. going to be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved with **Yes** if Donald Trump Jr. is selected as the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election by the Republican National Convention. If any other individual is chosen, the outcome will be a **No**. The question remains open to other candidates who are not currently in consideration; new contenders may appear in the future.

The answer to this inquiry is determined solely by the individual elected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention), regardless of who is nominated on the date of the 2024 US election.

question.title: Will JD Vance say "Couch" before August?
question.body:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if J.D. Vance publicly mentions the word "Couch" between July 25, 5:30 PM ET and July 31, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No."

Pluralization/possessive of the word will count toward the resolution of this market.

A 'mention' includes the following:

-A verbal usage of the word "Couch".
-Any written usage of the word "Couch" published through J.D. Vance's social media or other official communication channels regardless of capitalization (@JDVance would qualify however @SenVancePress will not count).

Videos posted on his social media which were filmed outside this market's time frame will not qualify for a "Yes" resolution.

question.title: Will Russian athletes be barred from competing at the 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Russian athletes are barred from competing at the 2024 Olympics under either (i) the Russian flag, (ii) The Russian Olympic Committee's flag, or (iii) any other independent or neutral flag. This will resolve based on the official list of countries and athletes present at the [2024 Olympics](https://olympics.com/en/olympic-games/paris-2024) or based on credible media reports, indicating that the 2024 Olympics are underway or have concluded without Russian participation. For the question to resolve as **Yes**, no more than 34 Russians can be competing at the 2024 Olympics. 34 was chosen as 10% of [Russian athletes that participated in the 2020 Olympics](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Russian_Olympic_Committee_athletes_at_the_2020_Summer_Olympics) to allow for a few individual or sport specific exceptions.

If more than 34 Russian athletes compete at the 2024 Olympics, this question will resolve as **No**.

If the 2024 Olympics are cancelled or postponed to 2025 or afterwards, this question resolves as ambiguously.

para_P.title: Are Russian athletes going to be excluded from the 2024 Olympic Games?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if Russian athletes are excluded from participating in the 2024 Olympic Games under any of the following: (i) the Russian flag, (ii) the flag of the Russian Olympic Committee, or (iii) any other neutral or independent flag. The resolution will depend on the official roster of countries and athletes attending the [2024 Olympics](https://olympics.com/en/olympic-games/paris-2024) or credible media reports that confirm the 2024 Olympics are taking place or have ended without the involvement of Russian athletes. For the answer to be **Yes**, there cannot be more than 34 Russian athletes competing at the 2024 Olympics. The number 34 was selected as 10% of the [Russian athletes who took part in the 2020 Olympics](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Russian_Olympic_Committee_athletes_at_the_2020_Summer_Olympics) to permit a few individual or sport-specific exceptions.

Should more than 34 Russian athletes participate in the 2024 Olympics, this question will be answered as **No**.

If the 2024 Olympics are cancelled or delayed until 2025 or later, this question will be deemed ambiguous.

question.title: Will athletes from Russia be prohibited from participating in the 2024 Olympic Games?
question.body:
This inquiry will be answered with a **Yes** if athletes from Russia are prohibited from participating in the 2024 Olympic Games under (i) the Russian flag, (ii) the flag of the Russian Olympic Committee, or (iii) any independent or neutral flag. The resolution will be based on the official roster of countries and athletes attending the [2024 Olympics](https://olympics.com/en/olympic-games/paris-2024) or on credible media sources, confirming that the 2024 Olympics have commenced or concluded without Russian athletes. For a **Yes** resolution, no more than 34 Russian athletes can participate in the 2024 Olympics. The number 34 represents 10% of the [Russian athletes who took part in the 2020 Olympics](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Russian_Olympic_Committee_athletes_at_the_2020_Summer_Olympics) to permit a few individual or sport-specific exceptions.

If over 34 Russian athletes participate in the 2024 Olympics, the answer will be **No**.

In the event that the 2024 Olympics are cancelled or delayed to 2025 or later, this question will be deemed ambiguous.

para_P.title: Are Russian athletes going to be barred from competing in the 2024 Olympic Games?
para_P.body:
This question will receive a **Yes** response if athletes from Russia are barred from competing in the 2024 Olympic Games under (i) the Russian flag, (ii) the flag of the Russian Olympic Committee, or (iii) any independent or neutral flag. The determination will rely on the official list of nations and athletes participating in the [2024 Olympics](https://olympics.com/en/olympic-games/paris-2024) or on trustworthy media reports that confirm the 2024 Olympics have started or concluded without the inclusion of Russian athletes. A **Yes** answer necessitates that no more than 34 Russian athletes take part in the 2024 Olympics. This figure of 34 corresponds to 10% of the [Russian athletes who competed in the 2020 Olympics](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Russian_Olympic_Committee_athletes_at_the_2020_Summer_Olympics), allowing for a few individual or sport-specific exceptions.

If more than 34 Russian athletes are involved in the 2024 Olympics, the response will be **No**.

Should the 2024 Olympics be cancelled or postponed to 2025 or beyond, this inquiry will be considered ambiguous.

question.title: Will Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes, before the end of July 2024?
question.body:
The most recent qualifying interview was Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, when Biden answered questions for ~70 minutes. 

If Biden appears in another such in-person interview for at least 45 minutes, this market resolves YES. If no qualifying interview is released before market close at the end of July, this market resolves NO. 

This market does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes. However, there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to count. A 50 minute video might only feature 20 minutes of video of Biden being interviewed, and so would not count.

For context, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his past appearances on 60 minutes have each had less than 30 minutes of video footage of Biden being interviewed. 

You can find a list of Biden's interviews and their transcripts here.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Joe Biden will participate in a live, on-camera discussion for more than 45 minutes prior to the conclusion of July 2024?
para_P.body:
The latest qualifying interview took place in April when Biden was featured on The Howard Stern Show, where he responded to questions for approximately 70 minutes. 

This market will be marked as YES if Biden partakes in another in-person interview lasting at least 45 minutes. Conversely, if no qualifying interview is published before the market closes at the end of July, it will be marked as NO. 

This market excludes press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It may include podcast or late-night show appearances, or interviews that are edited into programs like 60 Minutes, provided there is a minimum of 45 minutes of fresh footage showing Biden being interviewed in-person. A 50-minute video that only contains 20 minutes of Biden being interviewed would not qualify. 

For reference, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his February appearance on Jimmy Fallon, and his previous segments on 60 Minutes all contained less than 30 minutes of footage featuring Biden being interviewed. 

A compilation of Biden's interviews and their transcripts can be accessed here.

If Biden engages in another such in-person interview for a minimum of 45 minutes, this market resolves YES. If no such interview is released before the market closes at the end of July, the market resolves NO.

This market excludes press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast or late-night show, or an interview edited into a program like 60 minutes. However, there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to qualify. For example, a 50-minute video might only include 20 minutes of Biden being interviewed, and thus would not qualify.

For reference, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his past appearances on 60 minutes each featured less than 30 minutes of video footage of Biden being interviewed.

A list of Biden's interviews and their transcripts is available here.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden engage in a face-to-face, on-camera interview that lasts 45 minutes or longer before the end of July 2024?
para_P.body:
The most recent qualifying interview with Biden took place on The Howard Stern Show in April, where he responded to questions for around 70 minutes.

If Biden takes part in another such in-person interview for at least 45 minutes, this market will conclude with a YES. Conversely, if no qualifying interview is published before the market closes at the end of July, it will conclude with a NO.

This market does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It may include guest appearances on a podcast or late-night show, or an interview that is edited into a program like 60 Minutes. However, there must be a minimum of 45 minutes of new footage showing Biden being interviewed in-person for these appearances to be valid. For instance, a 50-minute video might only feature 20 minutes of Biden being interviewed, and therefore would not qualify.

For reference, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his previous segments on 60 Minutes each contained less than 30 minutes of footage of Biden being interviewed.

question.title: Will OpenAI publicly commit to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle before July 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if, before July 1, 2024, both of the following are true:

- OpenAI publicly commits to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle via a statement from the company or a company spokesperson, such as Sam Altman. The statement may be formal (such as a press release) or informal (such as a tweet or quote in an interview). The statement from OpenAI must indicate a new level of commitment to the principle in question, relative to the time the righttowarn.ai statement was published; it cannot be a reiteration that, for example, "we already have a culture of open criticism". 
- Metaculus verifies that the company has accepted the principle to the satisfaction of at least one member of righttowarn.ai. Metaculus may reach out to select signatories or endorsers to assess their level of satisfaction with OpenAI's commitment. Statements must be at least as rigorous as "this was a good first step" for this question to resolve as **Yes**.

para_P.title: Will OpenAI make a public commitment to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle prior to July 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if, before July 1, 2024, both of the following conditions are met:

- OpenAI makes a public commitment to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle through a statement issued by the company or its spokesperson, such as Sam Altman. This statement can be either formal (like a press release) or informal (such as a tweet or a quote during an interview). The statement must reflect a new commitment level to the principle compared to the time when the righttowarn.ai statement was released; it cannot simply restate that, for example, "we already foster a culture of open criticism".
- Metaculus confirms that the company has embraced the principle to the satisfaction of at least one member of righttowarn.ai. Metaculus may contact selected signatories or endorsers to evaluate their satisfaction with OpenAI's commitment. Statements must be at least as strong as "this was a good first step" for this inquiry to be resolved as **Yes**.

question.title: Will OpenAI announce adherence to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" guideline before July 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question will be answered **Yes** if, prior to July 1, 2024, the following conditions are met:

- OpenAI makes a public declaration of adherence to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" guideline through a statement by the company or a representative, such as Sam Altman. The declaration can be formal (like a press release) or informal (such as a tweet or an interview remark). The statement must reflect a new level of adherence to the guideline compared to when the righttowarn.ai statement was released; it cannot merely restate that, for instance, "we already encourage open criticism".
- Metaculus confirms that the company has embraced the guideline to the satisfaction of at least one member of righttowarn.ai. Metaculus might contact certain signatories or supporters to gauge their satisfaction with OpenAI's adherence. Statements need to be at least as strong as "this was a positive initial step" for this question to be resolved as **Yes**.

para_P.title: Will OpenAI publicly declare their commitment to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" policy before July 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will receive a **Yes** response if, before July 1, 2024, the subsequent criteria are satisfied:

- OpenAI issues a public announcement affirming their commitment to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" policy via a statement from the organization or a spokesperson, such as Sam Altman. The announcement can be either formal (like a press release) or informal (such as a tweet or a comment made during an interview). The statement must indicate a heightened level of commitment to the policy compared to the time when the righttowarn.ai statement was issued; it cannot simply reiterate that, for example, "we already promote open criticism".
- Metaculus verifies that the organization has adopted the policy to the satisfaction of at least one member of righttowarn.ai. Metaculus may reach out to specific signatories or supporters to assess their contentment with OpenAI's adherence. Statements must be at least as strong as "this was a positive initial step" for this question to be marked as **Yes**.

question.title: Will the same nation win more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
This question resolves as **No** if women's teams representing eight different National Olympic Committees (NOC) win gold in these eight team sports at the 2024 Paris Olympics: 

- association football 
- 3×3 basketball
- 5×5 basketball
- field hockey
- handball 
- rugby sevens
- volleyball
- water polo.

Otherwise, the same NOC must have won at least two of these events, so the question resolves as **Yes**.

The question can resolve as soon as it becomes clear one of these conditions will happen (e.g. neither team playing the final of the last event has won any of the others).

para_P.title: Will a single country secure victories in multiple women's team sports at the 2024 Olympics?
para_P.body:
This inquiry concludes as **No** if women's teams from eight distinct National Olympic Committees (NOC) claim gold in these eight team sports at the 2024 Paris Olympics: 

- association football 
- 3×3 basketball
- 5×5 basketball
- field hockey
- handball 
- rugby sevens
- volleyball
- water polo.

Conversely, the same NOC must have achieved victory in at least two of these competitions for the question to resolve as **Yes**.

The question can be settled as soon as it is evident that one of these scenarios will occur (for instance, neither team competing in the final of the last event has won any of the others).

question.body:

- association football

- 5×5 basketball
- field hockey
- handball
- rugby sevens
- volleyball
- water polo.

Conversely, if a single NOC wins at least two of these competitions, the answer is **Yes**.

The question can be settled as soon as it becomes evident that one of these scenarios will occur (e.g., neither team in the final of the last event has claimed victory in any of the others).

para_P.title: Can one nation achieve triumph in multiple women's team competitions during the 2024 Olympic Games?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will receive a response of **No** if women's teams from eight different National Olympic Committees (NOC) each secure gold medals in the following eight team sports at the 2024 Paris Olympics:

- association football
- 3×3 basketball
- 5×5 basketball
- field hockey
- handball
- rugby sevens
- volleyball
- water polo.

On the other hand, if a single NOC emerges victorious in at least two of these events, the answer will be **Yes**.

The question can be resolved as soon as it is clear that one of these outcomes will take place (for instance, if neither team in the final of the last event has won in any of the others).

question.title: Will Tim Scott be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Tim Scott is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is Tim Scott going to be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if Tim Scott is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will result in a **No**. This question is not limited to the candidates currently acknowledged; additional options may be introduced later.

For this inquiry, it does not matter who secures the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is strictly based on who is appointed by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Is Tim Scott going to be chosen as the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This inquiry will be answered with a **Yes** if Tim Scott is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other individual being chosen will result in a **No**. This inquiry is open to candidates not currently listed; additional names may be included later.

For this inquiry, who actually receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election is not significant; it depends solely on who the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention) select.

For this question, the actual individual who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election is not relevant; it solely relies on who the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention) decide upon.

question.title: Will the Venezuelan electoral commission publish full results of the July 28 presidential election before August 12, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as Yes if [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report that, before Monday, August 12, 2024 at 12:01 AM Venezuelan Standard Time (VET), any entity of the Venezuelan government has published results of the July 28, 2024 election purporting to represent 100% of the votes cast, disaggregated to the level of parish (*parroquia*, a subdivision of municipalities).

para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered affirmatively if [reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) indicate that, before 12:01 AM Venezuelan Standard Time (VET) on Monday, August 12, 2024, any Venezuelan governmental body has disclosed results of the July 28, 2024 election claiming to represent all votes cast, detailed down to the parish level (*parroquia*, a subdivision of municipalities).

question.title: Will the Venezuelan election authorities release complete results for the July 28 presidential election by August 12, 2024?
question.body: This question will be answered with Yes if [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) confirm that, by 12:01 AM Venezuelan Standard Time (VET) on Monday, August 12, 2024, any branch of the Venezuelan government has made public the results of the July 28, 2024 election, claiming to account for 100% of the votes, broken down to the parish (*parroquia*, a subdivision of municipalities) level.

para_P.title: Will the electoral authorities in Venezuela publish the full results of the presidential election held on July 28 by August 12, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will receive a Yes answer if [reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) verify that, by 12:01 AM Venezuelan Standard Time (VET) on Monday, August 12, 2024, any sector of the Venezuelan government has disclosed the results of the election on July 28, 2024, asserting to represent 100% of the votes, detailed down to the parish (*parroquia*, a subdivision of municipalities) level.

para_P.title: Is the Pandemic Treaty going to be sanctioned during the World Health Assembly in May 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if the Pandemic Treaty is endorsed through a vote at the World Health Assembly (WHA) in May 2024, according to information from trustworthy sources.

question.title: Did someone intentionally shoot at Trump on July 13th?
question.body:
NYT: "It sounded what could be gun shots interrupted Trump’s rally in Pennsylvania. Trump was hurried off the stage and appeared to be bleeding by his ear."

Resolves YES if someone intentionally shot a bullet or other bullet-like projectile* at Trump on July 13th. Resolves NO if accidental discharge or ricochet caused something to shoot towards Trump.

*I am using bullet-like projectile to mean something that is for all intents and purposes is a bullet but may not technically be a bullet. For example, I would not count a BB gun pellet since it is not plausibly lethal like a bullet would be.

para_P.title: Was there a deliberate shooting aimed at Trump on July 13th?
para_P.body:
According to NYT: "The sound of what seemed like gunfire disrupted Trump’s rally in Pennsylvania. Trump was quickly taken off the stage and appeared to have a wound near his ear."

This resolves to YES if an individual deliberately fired a bullet or similar projectile at Trump on July 13th. It resolves to NO if the incident was caused by an accidental discharge or ricochet that directed something towards Trump.

*The term bullet-like projectile refers to any object that functions similarly to a bullet in its intended purpose, although it may not be classified as a traditional bullet. For instance, a BB gun pellet would not be included since it is not considered lethal like a bullet.

question.title: Was Trump the target of a deliberate shooting on July 13th?
question.body:
NYT: "Sounds resembling gunfire disrupted Trump’s rally in Pennsylvania. Trump was quickly escorted off the stage and seemed to have a wound near his ear."

This will resolve to YES if a person aimed and fired a bullet or similar projectile* at Trump on July 13th with intent. It will resolve to NO if the event was caused by an accidental firing or a ricochet that unintentionally directed something towards Trump.

*By bullet-like projectile, I mean an object that functions as a bullet for all practical purposes, though it may not technically be a bullet. For instance, a BB gun pellet wouldn’t count, as it lacks the plausible lethality of a bullet.

para_P.title: Was Trump intentionally shot at on July 13th?
para_P.body:
According to NYT: "Sounds resembling gunfire disrupted Trump’s rally in Pennsylvania. Trump was quickly escorted off the stage and seemed to have a wound near his ear."

This will resolve to YES if an individual aimed and discharged a bullet or similar projectile* at Trump on July 13th with intent. It will resolve to NO if the incident was the result of an accidental discharge or a ricochet that unintentionally directed something towards Trump.

*By bullet-like projectile, I refer to an object that serves the purpose of a bullet for all practical intents, although it may not technically be classified as a bullet. For example, a BB gun pellet would not qualify, as it does not possess the plausible lethality of a bullet.

question.title: Will Israel qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Israel participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Israel does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Israel going to make it to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if Israel takes part in a Semi-final and is officially confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024. Conversely, if Israel does not advance, the answer will be **No**.

question.title: Will Israel advance to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Israel takes part in a Semi-final and is officially declared by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Israel does not advance, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Israel going to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Israel participates in a Semi-final and is officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having progressed to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Israel fails to progress, the inquiry will conclude with a **No**.

question.title: Will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

para_P.title: Will a minimum of 20 Democrats from the House or Senate endorse a public letter against the proposal to nominate Biden prematurely?
para_P.body:
Context from Politico:

Numerous House Democrats are coordinating a strategy to voice their opposition to their party's initiative to finalize President Joe Biden's nomination earlier than initially planned, which they claim suppresses the critical ongoing discussion regarding his candidacy, as per a legislator involved in the movement.

A letter drafted and circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and acquired by POLITICO, represents the first public indication from Democrats following the recent attempted assassination of former President Donald Trump that many of their members are still quite concerned about the trajectory of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really poor decision by the DNC. Someone believes it’s a smart approach to stifle debate and I suppose through sheer force, achieve unity, but that’s not how it works,” Huffman remarked in an interview. He chose not to verify the existence of a letter.

This market will resolve to YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination strategy is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who align with the Democratic Party before the market closes at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Even if multiple letters collectively have 20 lawmakers' signatures, that would also be enough to resolve this market to YES. 

If these conditions are not fulfilled by the market close, this market will resolve to NO.

question.body:
Background from Politico:

A group of House Democrats is planning to voice their opposition to their party's strategy to expedite President Joe Biden’s nomination, which they believe suppresses the ongoing robust discussion about his candidacy, according to a participating lawmaker.

A letter in draft form, circulated by Representative Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, represents the first public indication from Democrats since the recent assassination attempt on former President Donald Trump that many of their members are still very uneasy about Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a very poor decision by the DNC. Someone thinks it’s a smart way to suppress debate and, through sheer force, create unity, but that’s not how it works,” Huffman stated in an interview. He refused to confirm the letter's existence.

This market will resolve to YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is endorsed by at least 20 Democratic House Members or Senators before the market closes at the end of Sunday, July 21st.

Multiple letters with a combined total of 20 signatures from lawmakers would also be enough to resolve this market to YES.

If these conditions are not fulfilled by the market's closure, the market will resolve to NO.

para_P.title: Will at least 20 Democratic legislators from the House or Senate publicly support a letter against the premature virtual nomination of Biden?
para_P.body:
Context from Politico:

A faction of House Democrats intends to express their dissent regarding their party's approach to hasten President Joe Biden’s nomination, which they argue stifles the ongoing vigorous debate about his candidacy, as stated by a participating lawmaker.

A draft letter, circulated by Representative Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and acquired by POLITICO, marks the first public indication from Democrats since the recent assassination attempt on former President Donald Trump that many of their members remain quite apprehensive about Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a very misguided choice by the DNC. Someone believes it’s an effective method to stifle discussion and, through sheer force, foster unity, but that’s not how it operates,” Huffman remarked in an interview. He declined to verify the letter's existence.

This market will resolve to YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination strategy is backed by a minimum of 20 Democratic House Members or Senators before the market closes at the end of Sunday, July 21st.

Multiple letters with an aggregate of 20 signatures from lawmakers would also suffice for this market to resolve to YES.

If these criteria are not met by the market's closure, it will resolve to NO.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden exceed 2 but not surpass 4 according to 538's average of national polls?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude based on the difference in favor of Donald Trump over Joe Biden as indicated by 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) on the chart dated July 15, 2024, when viewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure signifies a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure indicates Biden is in the lead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported figure shows Trump ahead of Biden by 2.4 points, which would be a positive figure of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

question.title: On July 15, 2024, will Trump have a lead over Biden that is more than 2 but not exceeding 4 according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This inquiry will be determined by Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden as reflected in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/), as shown on the graph for July 15, 2024, when checked by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For this question, a positive figure signifies a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure indicates Biden is ahead. As an illustration, on July 5, 2024, the reported figure for that day is Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which would be considered a positive figure of 2.4 for this question's context.

para_P.title: Will Trump have a margin over Biden greater than 2 but less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This question pertains to the extent of Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden as indicated by 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/), specifically on the graph dated July 15, 2024, and evaluated by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive value represents a lead for Trump, while a negative value denotes that Biden is in the lead. For example, on July 5, 2024, the reported figure showed Trump ahead of Biden by 2.4 points, which would be interpreted as a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this inquiry.

question.title: Will "Twisters" (2024) have a Rotten Tomatoes critics score of at least 75%? ("Certified Fresh")
question.body:
"Twisters" (2024) Rotten Tomatoes page

This resolves YES if the Tomatometer score is 75% or higher, one week after release (July 26th). 

Details 

I will use whatever precision is listed by Rotten Tomatoes (typically an integer percentage, no decimal).

For example, the original "Twister" (1996) currently has a Tomatometer of 63%. This is the equivalent score I will use.

"Certified Fresh" is just used for illustrative purposes (AFAIK, it requires >=75% Tomatometer, but there might be other restrictions—the market resolves solely based on the displayed score).

"Twisters" (2024) is a standalone sequel to the 1996 original, directed by Lee Isaac Chung ("Minari"), starring Glen Powell ("Top Gun: Maverick") and Daisy Edgar Jones ("Normal People").

The Rotten Tomatoes page for "Twisters" (2024)
