Details 

The precision used will be whatever is provided by Rotten Tomatoes (usually an integer percentage, without decimals).

For instance, the original "Twister" (1996) has a current Tomatometer of 63%. This score will be taken as is.

The term "Certified Fresh" is mentioned for illustration (to my knowledge, it requires a score of 75% or more on the Tomatometer, but there could be additional criteria—the market will resolve strictly based on the score that is shown).

"Twisters" (2024) is an independent sequel to the original film from 1996, directed by Lee Isaac Chung ("Minari"), featuring Glen Powell ("Top Gun: Maverick") and Daisy Edgar Jones ("Normal People").

question.title: Will Liz Cheney be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Liz Cheney is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Will Liz Cheney be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

Any other candidates will be resolved as **No**. This question is not limited to the candidates currently listed; additional options may be introduced later.

For the purpose of this question, it does not matter who obtains the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is exclusively determined by the selection made by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

For this question, the focus is not on who holds the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is exclusively about who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

The emphasis of this question is not on who has the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it strictly pertains to who is chosen by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office

para_P.title: Will the 25th Amendment Section 4 be used to declare Biden incapacitated prior to August?
para_P.body:
This will be considered a YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another appropriate body) activates Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his office" and appoint the Vice President as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The length of the incapacity is not relevant for this inquiry.

Biden leaving the Presidency due to death, resignation, etc., is not included. Biden's use of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment does not apply.

question.title: Will Biden be deemed unable to fulfill his presidential duties under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, before August 2024 (Eastern time), the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or another appropriate body) activate Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office," resulting in the Vice President assuming the role of Acting President.

The length of the incapacity is irrelevant to this question.

Biden leaving the presidency due to death, resignation, or similar reasons does not qualify. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment is also not applicable.

Background: A GOP legislator has requested Merrick Garland to use the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office.

para_P.title: Will Biden be considered incapable of executing his presidential responsibilities under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will result in a YES if, before August 2024 (Eastern time), the Vice President alongside a majority of the Cabinet (or another suitable entity) enacts Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to perform the powers and duties of his office," leading to the Vice President taking on the position of Acting President.

The duration of the incapacity does not factor into this question.

Biden's departure from the presidency due to death, resignation, or similar circumstances is not considered. Biden's invocation of section 3 of the 25th amendment is also not relevant.

Background: A Republican legislator has urged Merrick Garland to utilize the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office.

question.title: Will Blake Lively's "It Ends With Us" outgross her husband Ryan Reynold's "Deadpool & Wolverine" this weekend?
question.body:
Resolution 

This market resolves YES "It Ends with Us" has a higher (domestic) gross than "Deadpool & Wolverine" for the weekend of August 9-11. 

Source: The "weekend" tab in BoxOfficeMojo, for August 9-11.

I will use the number listed by BoxOfficeMojo, however it is defined (e.g. typically 3-day FSS wekeend + previews).

Example: last weekend, the "Deadpool & Wolverine" grossed $96.8M, far ahead of the "Trap", which opened to $15.4M.

Context 

"Deadpool & Wolverine" has been crushing the box office, and is expected to repeat with its 3rd weekend at #1. 

The potential long shot that could dethrone it is "It Ends With Us", the adaptation of Colleen Hoover's mega-bestseller, starring (funnily enough) Ryan Reynold's wife, Blake Lively.

para_P.title: Will Blake Lively's film "It Ends With Us" surpass her spouse Ryan Reynolds' "Deadpool & Wolverine" in box office earnings this weekend?
para_P.body:
Resolution 

This market will resolve YES if "It Ends with Us" achieves a greater (domestic) box office total than "Deadpool & Wolverine" during the weekend of August 9-11. 

Source: Refer to the "weekend" section on BoxOfficeMojo for the dates of August 9-11.

I will consider the figures provided by BoxOfficeMojo, regardless of how they are calculated (e.g. usually 3-day FSS weekend plus previews).

Example: in the previous weekend, "Deadpool & Wolverine" earned $96.8M, significantly outpacing the "Trap", which debuted with $15.4M.

Context 

"Deadpool & Wolverine" has been dominating the box office and is anticipated to maintain its #1 position in its third weekend. 

The potential underdog that could challenge it is "It Ends With Us", the movie based on Colleen Hoover's hugely popular novel, featuring (ironically) Ryan Reynolds' wife, Blake Lively.

question.title: Will UCLA hold its in-person, university-wide graduation commencement ceremonies scheduled for June 14, 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if the University of California-Los Angeles (UCLA) holds all three of its main in-person college commencement ceremonies for the graduating Class of 2024 [scheduled](https://commencement.ucla.edu/schedule/ucla-commencement-schedule-alphabetical#college) for the following times and locations on June 14, 2024:

- 11 AM at the Pauley Pavilion
- 3 PM at the Pauley Pavilion
- 7 PM at the Pauley Pavilion

The ceremonies must all occur at the specified locations and begin within 1 hour of the scheduled starting time. 

This question will resolve as **No** if any ceremony either does not begin within an hour of the scheduled time, is moved to another location, or is held entirely online (i.e., without graduates, faculty, and guests attending in person).

question.body:

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/24034/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question resolves as Yes if before August 1, 2024, one of these four events happens, according to official statements or credible reports:

The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC).

The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.

The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.

The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines.

If there are no such reports before that date, then this resolves as No.

question.title: Will the domestic box office opening of "Deadpool & Wolverine" be higher than that of "Deadpool" and "The Wolverine" combined?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the domestic box office opening for the **Deadpool & Wolverine** reported by Boxofficemojo on the [movie's page](https://www.boxofficemojo.com/title/tt6263850/?ref_=bo_se_r_1) is higher than $185,548,391 which is the sum of the box openings for **Deadpool** (2016) and **The Wolverine** (2013): $132,434,639 + $53,113,752.

para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if the opening weekend gross for **Deadpool & Wolverine** as reported by Boxofficemojo on the [movie's page](https://www.boxofficemojo.com/title/tt6263850/?ref_=bo_se_r_1) exceeds $185,548,391, which is the total of the box office earnings for **Deadpool** (2016) and **The Wolverine** (2013): $132,434,639 + $53,113,752.

question.title: Will the initial domestic box office earnings of "Deadpool & Wolverine" surpass the combined openings of "Deadpool" and "The Wolverine"?
question.body: This question will be answered with a **Yes** if the initial domestic box office revenue for **Deadpool & Wolverine**, as reported by Boxofficemojo on the [movie's page](https://www.boxofficemojo.com/title/tt6263850/?ref_=bo_se_r_1), exceeds $185,548,391. This amount is the total of the opening revenues for **Deadpool** (2016) and **The Wolverine** (2013): $132,434,639 + $53,113,752.

para_P.title: Will the opening weekend earnings of "Deadpool & Wolverine" be greater than the total box office openings of "Deadpool" and "The Wolverine"?
para_P.body: This inquiry will receive a **Yes** response if the opening weekend box office earnings for **Deadpool & Wolverine**, as listed by Boxofficemojo on the [movie's page](https://www.boxofficemojo.com/title/tt6263850/?ref_=bo_se_r_1), surpasses $185,548,391. This figure represents the sum of the opening weekend earnings for **Deadpool** (2016) and **The Wolverine** (2013): $132,434,639 + $53,113,752.

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce that he is both dropping out and resigning from the presidency before the end of July?
question.body:
Resolves YES if Joe Biden announces both that he is no longer running for re-election and that he will be resigning and not completing his current term. These announcements before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time, but he does not have to have formally resigned and be out of office before the end of July. An announcement of his intention to do so is sufficient to resolve this market.

Otherwise, this market resolves NO on August 1st.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden declare his intention to both withdraw from the presidential race and step down from the presidency prior to July's conclusion?
para_P.body:
This will resolve to YES if Joe Biden makes an announcement indicating that he is ceasing his campaign for re-election and that he plans to resign from his current presidential term. Such announcements must occur before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time, although he is not required to have formally resigned and vacated his position by that time. A declaration of his intention to resign is adequate to settle this market.

If these announcements do not occur, the market will resolve to NO on August 1st.

question.title: Is it true that Joe Biden will declare his withdrawal from the presidential race and his resignation from office by the end of July?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if Joe Biden states that he will not seek re-election and will resign, not finishing his present term. The announcement must occur by the end of July 2024, Pacific Time. He doesn't need to have officially resigned by then; merely announcing his intention suffices for a YES resolution.

If not, this question resolves as NO on August 1st.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden announce his exit from the presidential race and his resignation from the presidency before July concludes?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered affirmative if Joe Biden declares that he will not pursue re-election and will step down, thereby not completing his current term. The declaration must take place by the end of July 2024, Pacific Time. It is not necessary for him to have officially resigned by that date; simply announcing his intention is adequate for a YES outcome.

If he does not make such an announcement, the question will be deemed negative on August 1st.

question.title: Will S&D hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?

question.title: Will Individual Neutral Athletes Win ≥15 Gold Medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win 15 or more gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games. The source of resolution will be the official medal tally published by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other credible sources if such reporting from the IOC is unavailable. Otherwise the market will resolve to "No".

In the event that Individual Neutral Athletes are confirmed to have won 15 or more gold medals prior to the end of the Games, the market will resolve immediately to "Yes".

para_P.title: Will Individual Neutral Athletes Achieve 15 or More Gold Medals at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
para_P.body:
This market will conclude with a "Yes" if Individual Neutral Athletes together secure 15 or more gold medals during the 2024 Olympic Games in Paris. The determination will be based on the official medal count provided by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other trustworthy sources if the IOC's reporting is not available. If not, the market will conclude with a "No".

Should it be confirmed that Individual Neutral Athletes have won 15 or more gold medals before the Games conclude, the market will immediately resolve to "Yes".

question.title: Will Neutral Competitors Secure 15 or More Gold Medals at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body:
This question will be answered with "Yes" if Neutral Competitors collectively achieve 15 or more gold medals at the 2024 Paris Olympic Games. The official medal count from the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other reliable sources will be used for resolution if the IOC's report is not available. Otherwise, the answer will be "No".

If Neutral Competitors are confirmed to have secured 15 or more gold medals before the Games conclude, the answer will be immediately "Yes".

para_P.title: Will Non-affiliated Athletes Obtain 15 or More Gold Medals at the 2024 Summer Olympics in Paris?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will receive a "Yes" response if Non-affiliated Athletes collectively win 15 or more gold medals during the 2024 Summer Olympic Games in Paris. The official medal tally from the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other trustworthy sources will be referenced for resolution if the IOC's report is unavailable. If not, the response will be "No".

Should it be confirmed that Non-affiliated Athletes have achieved 15 or more gold medals prior to the conclusion of the Games, the answer will be immediately "Yes".

question.title: Will at least 30% of Manifold respondents agree that weak AGI had been achieved before July 23, 2024?
question.body:
[image]Every month, a Manifold poll is being posted to gain the consensus view of progress towards AGI. Unlike many of the markets and questions on Manifold, these polls will simply ask "has weak AGI been achieved," rather than providing a definition of the term. The goal is that given that the term is so broad, the only way to characterize AI progress is also to allow respondents to vote based upon their own understanding.

Progress has been steady.  The previous polls are referenced here:

@/SteveSokolowski/did-openai-achieve-weak-agi-with-gp  (Answer: 15)

@/SteveSokolowski/june-2024-has-weak-agi-been-achieve  (Answer: 27)

The previous markets on this topic, which significantly understimated Manifold's belief in AI progress, were:

@/SteveSokolowski/what-percentage-of-manifold-poll-re 

@/SteveSokolowski/will-at-least-20-of-manifold-respon 

The polls will not reference any specific model, and will not define "AGI" except to state that the poll does not require that the software system be able to manipulate the physical world. The polls open on the 23rd of each month and close on the 30th.

This market will resolve to YES if the July 2024 poll results in a ratio of YES/(NO + YES) greater than or equal to 0.3. The "no opinion" respondents will be ignored. Otherwise, this question will resolve to NO.

See also:

@/SteveSokolowski/will-one-of-the-monthly-has-weak-ag

question.title: Will diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before June 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if before June 1, 2024, one of these four events happens, according to official statements or [credible reports](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions): 

- The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC). 

- The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.

- The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.

- The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines. 

If there are no such reports before that date, then this resolves as **No**.

- The Philippines withdraws at least one of its diplomats from the PRC.

- The PRC removes at least one diplomat from the Philippines.

- The PRC withdraws at least one of its diplomats from the Philippines.

question.title: Iran military response before August 13th midnight Eastern Time?
question.body:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Iran initiates a military action on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory between July 30 and August 12, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

For the purposes of this market, a "military action" will be considered to be any use of force executed by Iran on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory (e.g. if a weapons depot on Israeli soil is hit by an Iranian missile, this market will resolve to "Yes") that is officially acknowledged by the Iranian government or a consensus of credible reporting. This includes, but is not limited to, airstrikes, naval attacks, or ground invasions. Cyber attacks, sanctions, or diplomatic actions will not count towards the resolution of this market.

Only responses by Iranian forces explicitly claimed by the Islamic Republic of Iran, or confirmed to have originated from Iranian territory will count toward the resolution of this market. Attacks on Israel by proxy forces (i.e. Hezbollah, Houthis, etc.) will not count toward the resolution of this market.

para_P.title: Military action by Iran before midnight ET on August 13?
para_P.body:
This market will settle on "Yes" if Iran carries out a military operation on Israeli territory, airspace, or waters between July 30 and August 12, 2024, at 11:59 PM ET. If no such action occurs, the market will settle on "No".

For this market, a "military operation" refers to any aggressive act conducted by Iran against Israeli territory, airspace, or waters (for instance, if an Iranian missile strikes a weapons facility in Israel, the market will settle on "Yes") that is officially recognized by the Iranian government or corroborated by reliable reports. This encompasses, but is not limited to, airstrikes, naval assaults, or ground invasions. Cyber warfare, economic sanctions, or diplomatic measures will not be considered for this market's resolution.

Only actions taken by Iranian military forces that are explicitly acknowledged by the Islamic Republic of Iran, or verified to have originated from Iranian land, will be relevant for this market's outcome. Attacks on Israel by proxy groups (such as Hezbollah, Houthis, etc.) will not be included in this market's resolution.

question.title: Will Iran take military action against Israel by August 13th, Eastern Time?
question.body:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Iran carries out a military operation in Israeli territory, airspace, or waters between July 30 and August 12, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, it will resolve to "No".

For the purpose of this market, "military operation" refers to any act of aggression conducted by Iran in Israeli territory, airspace, or waters (e.g., if an Iranian missile strikes a weapons facility on Israeli land, the market will resolve to "Yes") that is officially recognized by the Iranian government or widely reported by credible sources. This includes, but is not limited to, aerial bombardments, naval engagements, or land invasions. Cyber warfare, economic sanctions, or diplomatic efforts are excluded from this market's resolution criteria.

Only actions by Iranian military forces explicitly acknowledged by the Islamic Republic of Iran, or verified to have been launched from Iranian land will be considered for this market's resolution. Attacks on Israel by proxy groups (such as Hezbollah, Houthis, etc.) will not be included in this market's resolution.

para_P.title: Will Iran engage in military operations against Israel prior to August 13th, Eastern Time?
para_P.body:
This market will determine a "Yes" outcome if Iran executes a military action within Israeli territory, airspace, or waters between July 30 and August 12, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. If not, it will conclude with a "No".

For this market, a "military action" is defined as any aggressive act undertaken by Iran in Israeli territory, airspace, or waters (for instance, if an Iranian missile hits a military installation on Israeli soil, the market will record a "Yes") that is officially acknowledged by the Iranian government or widely reported by credible news outlets. This encompasses, but is not limited to, aerial strikes, naval confrontations, or ground invasions. Cyber attacks, financial sanctions, or diplomatic initiatives are not part of the criteria for this market's resolution.

Only actions by Iranian military forces that are explicitly recognized by the Islamic Republic of Iran, or confirmed to have originated from Iranian soil will be taken into account for this market's resolution. Attacks on Israel by proxy organizations (such as Hezbollah, Houthis, etc.) will be excluded from this market's resolution.

question.title: Will Rishi Sunak fail to be elected in the 2024 UK General Election?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if for any reason Rishi Sunak fails to be elected as a Member of Parliament in the July 4 2024 UK general election.

If Sunak is elected as a Member of Parliament for any constituency in the July 4 2024 UK general election, this question will resolve as **No**.

Resolution should cite [credible](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) media reports, or an official announcement from the returning officer of the constituency in which Sunak is a candidate (if he is a candidate in any constituency).

para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if Rishi Sunak does not secure a position as a Member of Parliament in the UK general election taking place on July 4, 2024.

Conversely, if Sunak does achieve election as a Member of Parliament for any constituency during the July 4, 2024 UK general election, the outcome will be recorded as **No**.

The resolution must reference [credible](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) news sources, or an official declaration from the returning officer of the constituency where Sunak is contesting (if he is indeed a candidate in any constituency).

If Sunak successfully becomes a Member of Parliament for any constituency in the July 4 2024 UK general election, the answer to this question will be **No**.

The resolution should be based on [credible](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) media reports, or an official announcement from the returning officer of the constituency where Sunak is a candidate (if he is standing in any constituency).

question.title: Will 538 Project Biden as the favorite on Friday?
question.body:
This market will resolve to “Yes” if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. This market will resolve to “No” if Donald Trump has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this market will resolve 50-50.

The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for this market's resolution date. Changes in the methodology by which FiveThirtyEight calculates its figures will have no bearing on the resolution of this market.

This market will resolve according to the datapoints for July 19 as soon as datapoints for July 20 become available. This market may not resolve until the July 20 datapoints are available. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

Please note the resolution refers to the odds of each candidate winning as a number out of 100 reported to the 1 digit mark (eg. "Trump 57 times out of 100"). The listed number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will NOT be considered.

para_P.title: Will FiveThirtyEight consider Biden the frontrunner on Friday?
para_P.body:
This market will conclude with a “Yes” if Joe Biden is assessed to have a greater chance of winning the US presidential election compared to Donald Trump, based on the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024. Conversely, it will conclude with a “No” if Donald Trump is evaluated to have a superior probability of winning the US presidential election over Joe Biden, according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for that same date. In the event that both candidates have equal probabilities, the market will resolve 50-50.

The resolution will rely on FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, accessible at https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically using the data indicated by the blue and red trend lines for the date of resolution. Any changes in the methodology used by FiveThirtyEight to derive its figures will not affect the outcome of this market.

The market will resolve based on the data for July 19 once the data for July 20 becomes available. It may not reach a conclusion until the July 20 data is accessible. If no data for July 19 is available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, the market will resolve based on the closest prior figures to July 19.

Please be aware that the resolution pertains to the winning odds of each candidate expressed as a number out of 100, rounded to one decimal place (for example, "Trump 57 out of 100"). The number of simulations won by each candidate out of 1,000 will not be taken into account.

question.title: Will FiveThirtyEight Rank Biden as the Frontrunner on Friday?
question.body:
This question will be answered with “Yes” if Joe Biden is shown to have a greater likelihood of winning the U.S. presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024. Conversely, it will be answered with “No” if Donald Trump is shown to have a greater likelihood of winning than Joe Biden on the same date according to the same source. If the probabilities are tied, the outcome will be a 50-50 resolution.

The source for this resolution is the FiveThirtyEight 2024 presidential election forecast, accessible at https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, focusing specifically on the data indicated by the blue and red trend lines for the resolution date of this question. Any changes in FiveThirtyEight's calculation methods will not affect the outcome.

The resolution will use the July 19 data as soon as the July 20 data is available. The resolution may be delayed until July 20 data is available. If July 19 data is not available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, the outcome will be determined by the closest prior data to July 19.

Note that the resolution pertains to the likelihood of each candidate winning, expressed as a number out of 100 and reported to one decimal place (e.g., "Trump 57 times out of 100"). The reported number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will not be used.

para_P.title: Will FiveThirtyEight Identify Biden as the Leading Candidate This Friday?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will receive a “Yes” response if Joe Biden is indicated to have a higher probability of securing victory in the U.S. presidential election compared to Donald Trump, according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast dated July 19, 2024. Conversely, it will be marked as “No” if Donald Trump is indicated to have a superior chance of winning compared to Joe Biden on the same date from the same source. In the event of tied probabilities, the result will be a 50-50 determination.

The basis for this conclusion is the FiveThirtyEight 2024 presidential election forecast, which can be found at https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically analyzing the data represented by the blue and red trend lines for the resolution date of this question. Any modifications in FiveThirtyEight's calculation methods will not influence the outcome.

The resolution will utilize the July 19 data as soon as the July 20 data becomes available. There may be a delay in the resolution until the July 20 data is accessible. If July 19 data is unavailable by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, the result will be determined by the nearest prior data to July 19.

It is important to note that the resolution concerns the probability of each candidate winning, expressed as a number out of 100 and reported to one decimal place (for example, "Trump 57 times out of 100"). The reported number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will not be considered.

question.title: Will TCB Scans upload chapter 1122 of One Piece on August 1st?
question.body:
https://manifold.markets/news/shortfuse-one-piece

I am basing this off of GMT-7 time zone for July 18th If they release chapter 1122 between 00:00:00 and 23:59:59, this question will resolve as “YES.” Anything else will resolve as “NO.”

TCB Scans usually posts the chapter on the Thursday before official release. 1121. 1120, 1119, 1118, 1117, 1116 and 1115 were Thursdays. 1114 was a Thursday, May 9th. 1113 was a Friday, April 25th. 1112 was a Friday, April 19. 1111 will be uploaded March 22, a Friday. 1110 was uploaded March 15th, a Friday. 1109 was uploaded March 1, a Friday. 1108 was February 22, 1107 was February 15, both Thursdays. 

TCB has started posting on Fridays after the twitter account ban. Unknown if this shall continue, thought I’d put the info here for investors.

I do not answer my own questions.

question.title: Will TCB Scans release One Piece chapter 1122 on August 1st?
question.body:
https://manifold.markets/news/shortfuse-one-piece

This question is based on the GMT-7 time zone for July 18th. If chapter 1122 is released by TCB Scans between 00:00:00 and 23:59:59, the answer will be “YES.” Otherwise, it will be “NO.”

Historically, TCB Scans tends to upload the chapter on the Thursday prior to the official release. Chapters 1121, 1120, 1119, 1118, 1117, 1116, and 1115 were all uploaded on Thursdays. Following the ban of their Twitter account, TCB has shifted to posting on Fridays. It is uncertain if this pattern will persist, but I wanted to provide this information for investors.

I do not respond to my own questions.

question.title: Will Biden remain President through end of July 2024?
question.body:
Resolves YES if Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then.

Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendement (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

para_P.title: Is Biden expected to hold the presidency until the conclusion of July 2024?
para_P.body:
This resolves to YES if Biden continues to be the President of the United States until the end of July 2024 (ET); it resolves to NO if he steps down, passes away, or otherwise stops being President before that date.

A temporary delegation of authority under the 25th amendment (such as appointing his Vice President as Acting President) does not result in a YES resolution. (An Acting President is not the same as the President according to the Constitution)

question.title: Will Biden continue as President until after July 2024?
question.body: The question will be answered YES if Biden stays in his role as US President past the end of July 2024 (ET); it will be answered NO if he steps down, passes away, or otherwise stops being President before that time. A temporary handover of power under the 25th amendment, making the Vice President the Acting President, does not lead to a YES answer, as the Acting President is distinct from the President according to the Constitution.

para_P.title: Will Biden remain in office as President beyond July 2024?
para_P.body: The response will be YES if Biden remains in his position as the US President after the conclusion of July 2024 (ET); it will be NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President prior to that date. A temporary transfer of authority under the 25th amendment, designating the Vice President as the Acting President, does not result in a YES answer, since the Acting President is considered separate from the President according to the Constitution.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Donald Trump will be disqualified or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position due to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude with a "Yes" if, as of July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially disqualified or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The disqualification or prevention is validated through official announcements from state governments, court rulings, legal documents, or reliable media reports. Speculative articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial statements will not be adequate for resolution.

The inquiry will conclude with a "No" if these conditions are not satisfied as of July 15, 2024.

Note: This question does not consider any legal disputes, appeals, or later reversals that might happen after the specified date. It solely concerns whether Donald Trump has been disqualified from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position under the stated grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is disqualified or prevented from a ballot and then later reinstated, leading to him not being disqualified or prevented from any ballot as of July 15th, the inquiry will resolve negatively.

question.title: Will any U.S. state disqualify Donald Trump from appearing on the primary election ballot for a federal position under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This inquiry will be answered with "Yes" if, as of July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump is officially disqualified from appearing on the primary election ballot for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) in any U.S. state, based on the criteria of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The disqualification is verified by official state government declarations, judicial rulings, legal documents, or reliable media coverage. Speculative articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial statements will not be sufficient for resolution.

The inquiry will be answered with "No" if these criteria are not fulfilled by July 15, 2024.

Note: The inquiry does not consider legal disputes, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might happen *after* the specified date. It strictly relates to whether Donald Trump is disqualified from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position under the mentioned criteria as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is disqualified from a ballot and then reinstated, resulting in him not being disqualified from any ballot as of July 15th, the inquiry will be answered negatively.

para_P.title: Is there any U.S. state that will prevent Donald Trump from being on the primary election ballot for a federal role in accordance with Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
This question will receive a "Yes" answer if, by July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump is formally barred from being on the primary election ballot for a federal role (President, Senate, House of Representatives) in any U.S. state, based on the stipulations of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The barring must be confirmed by official state government announcements, court decisions, legal paperwork, or credible news reports. Speculative articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial comments will not suffice for a resolution.

The question will be answered with "No" if these conditions are not met by July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not take into account legal challenges, appeals, or later reversals that may occur *after* the specified date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump is barred from any state's primary election ballot for a federal role based on the stated criteria as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is barred from a ballot and then reinstated, leading to him not being barred from any ballot as of July 15th, the question will be answered negatively.

question.title: Will Tucker Carlson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:

Any other candidate being selected will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will the same nation win more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
This question resolves as No if women's teams representing eight different National Olympic Committees (NOC) win gold in the eight team sports - association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, voleyball and water polo.

Otherwise, the same NOC must have won at least two of these events, so the question resolves as **Yes**.

para_P.title: Is it possible for a single country to secure victories in multiple women's team sports during the 2024 Olympic Games?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude as No if women's teams from eight distinct National Olympic Committees (NOC) achieve gold medals in the eight team sports - association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo.

Conversely, the same NOC must have claimed at least two of these championships for the question to resolve as **Yes**.

question.title: Will a single country secure multiple gold medals in women's team sports at the 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
This question will be answered with No if women's teams from eight distinct National Olympic Committees (NOCs) each win gold in the eight team sports - association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo.

Otherwise, if the same NOC clinches gold in at least two of these events, the answer will be **Yes**.

para_P.title: Is it possible for one nation to achieve victory in several women's team events at the 2024 Olympic Games?
para_P.body:
The response will be No if teams representing eight different National Olympic Committees (NOCs) each earn a gold medal in the eight team events - association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo.

Conversely, if a single NOC secures gold in two or more of these competitions, the answer will be **Yes**.

question.title: Will Russia have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if, when accessed by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under any of the following categories:



- Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine

- Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours

- Assessed Russian Control

- Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Russian control of the location



The question will resolve as **No** if the location is not assessed to be in any of the categories indicating Russian control, which includes but is not limited to:



- Reported Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Past 24 Hours

- Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives

- Reported Ukrainian Partisan Warfare

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Ukrainian control of the location or a lack of Russian control of the location

- Evaluated Russian Progress in Ukraine

- Any additional classifications established by ISW that signify Russian control of the area



The inquiry will resolve with a **No** if the site is not classified under any categories indicating Russian control, which encompasses but is not limited to:



- Documented Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Last 24 Hours

- Documented Ukrainian Partisan Warfare

- Any additional classifications established by ISW that signify Ukrainian control of the area or a lack of Russian control over the area.

question.title: Will Nigel Farage be elected as a Member of Parliament in the July 4 2024 UK General Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** in the event that in the 2024 UK general election held on July 4, 2024, Nigel Farage is elected as the member of parliament (MP) for any UK constituency. The question will resolve as **No** if this does not occur, unless the general election is cancelled or postponed beyond July 4 2024, in which case the question will be **annulled**.

Resolution should cite credible media reports from the BBC, the Times, the Financial Times, the Guardian, or other major UK news sources; or the official announcement of the returning officer for any constituency in which Nigel Farage is a candidate. 

Farage need not be sworn in as an MP for the question to resolve as **Yes** -- this question resolves on the basis of his election or non-election.

para_P.title: Is Nigel Farage going to be chosen as a Member of Parliament in the UK General Election on July 4, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if Nigel Farage is chosen as the member of parliament (MP) for any constituency in the UK during the general election taking place on July 4, 2024. It will be answered with **No** if he is not elected, unless the general election is either cancelled or delayed beyond July 4, 2024, in which case the question will be deemed **annulled**.

The resolution should reference trustworthy media coverage from the BBC, the Times, the Financial Times, the Guardian, or other prominent UK news outlets; or the official statement from the returning officer for any constituency where Nigel Farage is a candidate.

It is not necessary for Farage to be officially sworn in as an MP for the question to be resolved as **Yes** -- the determination is based solely on whether he is elected or not.

question.title: Will Nigel Farage secure a seat as an MP in the UK General Election on July 4, 2024?
question.body:
This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Nigel Farage is elected as a member of parliament (MP) for any UK constituency during the UK general election scheduled for July 4, 2024. A **No** outcome will result if he is not elected, unless the general election is cancelled or postponed beyond July 4, 2024, in which case the inquiry will be **voided**.

Resolution should reference reliable media reports from sources like the BBC, the Times, the Financial Times, the Guardian, or other prominent UK news outlets; or the official declaration of the returning officer for any constituency where Nigel Farage is a candidate.

Farage does not need to be sworn in as an MP for the inquiry to conclude with a **Yes** -- the decision is based on his election or lack thereof.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Nigel Farage will obtain a parliamentary seat in the UK General Election on July 4, 2024?
para_P.body:
This question will be answered with a **Yes** if Nigel Farage is chosen as a member of parliament (MP) for any constituency in the UK during the general election taking place on July 4, 2024. A **No** response will occur if he is not chosen, unless the general election is cancelled or postponed past July 4, 2024, in which case the question will be considered **void**.

The resolution should be based on trustworthy media reports from sources such as the BBC, the Times, the Financial Times, the Guardian, or other major UK news organizations; or the official announcement from the returning officer for any constituency where Nigel Farage is running.

Farage does not need to officially take his seat as an MP for the question to be answered with a **Yes** -- the outcome relies solely on whether he is elected or not.

question.title: Will Scotland hold an official, sanctioned referendum on independence before May 3, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if there is a referendum held in Scotland regarding Scotland's independence from the United Kingdom, and this referendum is held before May 3, 2024.  This referendum may be an "advisory" referendum; that is, it is not necessary for the referendum to have any legally binding effect.

It shall not be deemed resolved by a “wildcat” or “Catalan” style of referendum where the UK government has declined permission for the vote, nor by a vote organised by civil society institutions. A referendum must be deemed to have the consent of the London government

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Scotland will conduct an official, authorized referendum on independence prior to May 3, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if a referendum concerning Scotland's independence from the United Kingdom takes place in Scotland before May 3, 2024. This referendum can be an "advisory" referendum; meaning it does not need to have any legal binding consequences.

A referendum will not be considered resolved by a “wildcat” or “Catalan” type of referendum where the UK government has refused permission for the vote, nor by a vote organized by civil society groups. For a referendum to be valid, it must have the approval of the London government.

question.title: Will Scotland conduct an official and authorized vote on independence prior to May 3, 2024?
question.body:
This question will be answered as **Yes** if a vote is conducted in Scotland about its independence from the United Kingdom, and this vote occurs before May 3, 2024. This vote can be an "advisory" vote; meaning, it does not need to have any legally binding consequences.

It will not be considered resolved by a “wildcat” or “Catalan” type of vote where the UK government has not granted permission for the vote, nor by a vote organized by civil society groups. A vote must be considered to have the approval of the London government.

para_P.title: Is Scotland going to hold a sanctioned and official referendum on independence before May 3, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be marked as **Yes** if Scotland holds a referendum regarding its independence from the United Kingdom, and this referendum takes place prior to May 3, 2024. This referendum may be an "advisory" one; meaning, it does not have to carry any legal obligations.

It will not be deemed resolved by a “wildcat” or “Catalan” style vote where the UK government has not authorized the referendum, nor by a vote arranged by civic organizations. A vote must be recognized as having the endorsement of the government in London.

question.title: Will a terrorist act occur in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
question.body:
The question will resolve as Yes if a terrorist attack in [Metropolitan France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between, and inclusive of, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). The question will resolve as No if the above does not happen.

An event will be considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility of a terrorist incident happening in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered in the affirmative if a terrorist incident in [Metropolitan France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) results in injuries and/or fatalities to at least one individual, excluding the terrorist(s), from the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) to the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). Conversely, the response will be negative if the above conditions are not met.

An occurrence will be classified as a 'terrorist incident' if it is labeled as such by any governmental body of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

question.title: Will a terrorist attack take place in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
question.body:
This inquiry will conclude with a Yes if a terrorist incident in [Metropolitan France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) results in injury and/or death of at least one individual, excluding the terrorist(s), from the start of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) to the end of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024), inclusive. It will conclude with a No if the specified event does not occur.

An incident will be classified as a 'terrorist attack' if it is labeled as such by any French State agency, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility of a terrorist incident occurring in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympic Games?
para_P.body:
This question will be answered with a Yes if a terrorist event in [Metropolitan France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) leads to injury and/or fatality of at least one person, excluding the terrorist(s), from the commencement of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) to the conclusion of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024), inclusive. A No will be given if this event does not happen.

An event will be considered a 'terrorist incident' if it is designated as such by any French State authority, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

question.title: Will Ron DeSantis be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Ron DeSantis is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election. It is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

question.title: At the 2024 Olympics, will at least 5 countries win their debut gold medal?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if 5 or more countries win their first-ever Olympic gold medal at the Paris Olympics, according to [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).

question.title: Will at least 50 Kenyan military or police personnel arrive in Haiti before June 1, 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if, after May 22, 2024, and before June 1, 2024, credible sources report that at least 50 Kenyan military or police personnel have arrived in Haiti.

para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if, between May 22, 2024, and June 1, 2024, reliable sources indicate that no fewer than 50 Kenyan military or police personnel have been sent to Haiti.

question.title: Will a minimum of 50 Kenyan military or law enforcement officers reach Haiti before June 1, 2024?
question.body: This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if, between May 22, 2024, and June 1, 2024, trustworthy sources confirm that no fewer than 50 Kenyan military or police officers have reached Haiti.

para_P.title: Will at least 50 members of the Kenyan military or police arrive in Haiti prior to June 1, 2024?
